intro: Caiophora tucumana, commonly known as the Tucumán caiophora, is a species of flowering plant native to the high Andes of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Its leaves are typically broad and heart-shaped, with a rough texture. Caiophora tucumana is adapted to high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions.
